page.title: 11SLIT WOOD: WESTGATE
page.content: Slit Wood is a popular beauty spot at Westgate. The wood is a dene along the banks of Middlehope Burn. Many tourists visit Slit Wood to walk and have picnics. The stream with its series of waterfalls is very pretty but the visitors are picking some of the rarer plants. At the top of the wood are the remains of some old lead and ironstone mines. The Slit Vein was one of the richest in the area and pieces of galena and fluorspar can be found in the stream. Limestone fossils are also abundant in the valley. In the old dam above the lead workings mallard, teal, and moorhen can be found. The wood itself is rich in animal and plant life and salmon and sea trout spawn in the stream.
